programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: In the late 60s, Camaros, Mustangs, and Corvettes roared to the forefront of the muscle car world. When Ray gets offered a spot in a vintage race featuring these cars, he’s propelled to dive into their history and afforded a chance to get behind the wheel at the Brickyard. But because it is a pro-am race, Ray pulls in a partner – none other than Bill Elliott, aka “Awesome Bill from Dawsonville.”

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Everyone has a car they fell in love with. Maybe it was the first? Maybe it was the hot rod the guy down the street owned? In Ray’s case, it was the ’58 Chevy he saw in the iconic coming of age car movie, American Graffiti. When Ray gets the chance to own the car after years and years of pursuit, he jumps on it. But restoring the car to its "movie state" proves to be a grueling task that goes way beyond a typical build. But when it's you first love, you can't let her down.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: The premiere episode features a dive into the influence cars had on culture of California. From road racing in the 1940’s to the inception of the iconic Woody wagon on the California beach scene, automobiles undoubtedly shaped the West Coast attitude. Ray talks to The Beach Boys frontman Mike Love and surfing icon Laird Hamilton for a glimpse into the cars that are so connected to surfing culture.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray uncovers the secrets of America’s greatest racing sport in the foothills of North Carolina. When moonshiners were looking to outrun police officers, they would custom fit engines to race the back woods tracks. That sport eventually evolved into NASCAR and Ray talks to the early adopters of this national pastime.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Grammy-winning musician Marty Robbins lived a double life, flawlessly crossing between the glitz of the Grand Ole Opry and track at Talladega. One of few musicians to ever achieve success in both genres, Ray is determined to return Marty’s iconic 777 car to the race track travel back to the 60’s and 70’s.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Legendary drag racer Don “The Snake” Prudhomme proves he is no stranger to the thrill of racing rivalry. Prudhomme’s career and subsequent competition with driver Tom “The Mongoose” McEwan earned the pair an unforgettable imprint on American pop culture. Legions of kids in the 60’s and 70’s flocked to the shelves for Snake and Mongoose Matchbox cars which helped make drag racing an undisputable American pastime. Famed director Ron Howard makes an appearance to discuss the incredible stories hidden within the world of Formula 1 Racing, the topic of his latest, epic feature ‘Rush”.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray finds Buried Treasures in the form of two race cars that had been left almost completely untouched since the last time they were on a race track. One is found sitting in a barn with the other trapped in an old car hauler. Upon uncovering the cars, we find both have big stories to tell.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: A journey to Indianapolis unveils the winning car of the 1955 Indy 500 sits on the roof of an auto mechanic shop. More than 50 years after it’s magic at the track, prominent Indy mechanic/owner Chris Paulsen begins to restore the car and Ray talks about the evolution of America’s illustrious Indy 500.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Smokey Yunick, the most innovative mechanic in NASCAR history, sold his famous truck that hauled equipment & cars across the country. Ray is on a mission to uncover this storied truck that helped launch the beginning of NASCAR’s cross-country popularity.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Ray travels to Long Island, New York with the hopes of learning more about America’s first major auto racing competition. The race, which began at the turn of the 20th century, helped develop the first major American racing stars and drove American manufacturing to competitive standard with the highly progressive Europeans.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: Fred Dmuchowski is a New Jersey racing icon. He was a regular workingman who raced on weekends for fun and became a legend in his iconic 303 racer. Ray works to rebuild the 303 in homage to Fred who inspired him to pursue his career in motorsports.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: For Rick Hendrick, the Corvette inspired his first car purchase, which ultimately led to the creation of his car dealership empire and motorsports teams. Mr. H, as he goes by, gives us a rare look inside of his personal Corvette collection and takes us to General Motors World Headquarters to talk with GM Vice President of Global Design, Ed Welburn, about how this iconic car came about. Country superstar Brad Paisley makes a cameo appearance to talk about his prized ‘Vette and the influence of cars on his music.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: The last car Elvis drove the evening he passed was his beloved Stutz Blackhawk. Ray discovers that the car has been preserved and heads to Graceland to check out this iconic piece of American music history. Ray and the team reveal the impeccable preservation of the car at Charlotte Motor Speedway with Rick Hendrick (“Mr. H”) and, arguably Elvis Presley’s biggest fan, Dale Earnhardt Jr. While at Graceland, Ray and the team also get an exclusive look at the paneled station wagon Elvis used to get in and out of Graceland in disguise. It’s an intimate look at the King’s incredible automobiles and their secrets that only Elvis knew.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: This episode takes an inside look at the famous racing L88 Corvette. From its history, to its successes and heartbreaks, to the stories of the men that drove it. Now, it’s a car world’s version of the Flinstones meet the Jetsons, as the Owens Corning Corvette, which clinched 22 straight race victories, challenges the new Corvette C7-R at Sebring International Raceway. The original Owens Corning team reunites for the challenge and our crew goes behind the scenes for the Corvette test drive of a lifetime.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for how super clean automotive upholstery, as well as the proper chemicals and detailing tools for deep cleaning vinyl and rubber surfaces.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for how to polish automotive glass as well as water spot removal and selecting the right polisher for the detailing job.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: A 2000 Silverado comes into the shop with a recurring cooling problem. The guys put their detective hats on and find the root of the problem.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: The guys learn what it takes to finish King of the Hammers with the ESAB sponsored Ultra Four race truck in the shop.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie B. highlight the inner workings of the EcoBoost engine and show how it’s changing the game on the racetrack. Plus, Kevin gets a rare look behind the doors of Ford Racing’s dyno facility.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.sub-title: How to Buy a Classic Car
programme.desc: Willie B. and Kevin do some detective work on a ‘55 Nomad that may be the next addition to Willie’s collection. Meanwhile, a Jeep Wrangler is in the shop for an illuminating upgrade.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin heads to the world-renowned Pratt & Miller Engineering Headquarters for a closer look at the company’s upcoming projects and legendary past.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie B. tap into the pent-up power of a Ford F-150 EcoBoost by adding a new water-methanol injection system, intake, and exhaust before strapping it to the dyno.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Willie B. and Kevin bring in a high-mileage truck for a routine check-up and walk us through some repairs every car owner should know.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: Kevin and Willie B. take on the challenge of outfitting a Jeep for a rental company whose customer base isn’t known for driving cautiously.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: A 1968 Charger, a 1970 Challenger R/T, and a 1969 Charger are featured.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: A 1972 Dodge Charger is restored.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.sub-title: Drive a Mile in My Shoes
programme.desc: A 1969 Road Runner is featured.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Work on a 1972 Dodge Charger is continued.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The story about the 1972 Charger is briefly revisited, and past work leading to its completion is also revisited. Work on the 1972 Dodge Charger is completed and revealed to the owners.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: The 1970 Plymouth Superbird work is resumed, and the 1970 Charger R/T collision repair is completed. The 1970 Barracuda Convertible's 383 2bbl. V8 is assembled and painted.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: A secret is accidentally revealed by Mark. Mark and Daren visit the local AAMCO Transmissions to watch the overhaul of the 1970 Barracuda Convertible's 727 Automatic Transmission, and then the Barracuda has its A/C box and instrument panel installed. The 1970 Superbird assembly nears completion.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Automotive parts supplier Tony D'Agostino of Tony's Parts helps the shop get organized, and Mark tests his Mopar knowledge against Tony's. Work on a 1970 Plymouth Superbird is completed.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.sub-title: The Hills Have Eyes on a Superbird
programme.desc: The 1970 Superbird's restoration and story is recapped, and the Hills visit the shop to take delivery of the car, along with its original owner. Mike and Michael Hill drive the Superbird on a cross county trip home to South Carolina.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: With the 1970 Plymouth Superbird done and safely driven home, Mark is asked to restore a 1969 Daytona Charger. Due to its condition, Mark questions if it's practical and if it's even legal.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Just when things couldn't get more stressful, Mark agrees to finally get the 1930 Chevy Coach fully restored by the end of the week. Meanwhile, Mark QC's the next cars in the process of resurrection.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: See the complete 3-year restoration of Kimberly Cook's 1970 Barracuda Convertible: the body, paint, engine, and convertible top, culminating in Graveyard Carz' most emotional reveal to date.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: New shop. New crew. An All-new Graveyard Carz! The ghouls tackle a 1970 Cuda.
